text:
I was surprised to find Sarawak noodles at the airport, as I’ve been wanting to try Sarawak laksa for a long time. The kolomee was a little overcooked, but the laksa gravy was flavorful, with a nice balance of spices.

It’s hard to get a seat in the morning, so you have to walk around and wait

Had sarawak laksa and 3 layer tea. Laksa was not bad and would be slightly below your average hawker in Kuching. Broth could be more flavourful.

Tea was way too sweet... But texture was good.

Edit: 2nd try of laksa and this time too much oil. I think the broth is not mixed properly. Kolo mee worth trying
Surprising delicious bowl of Sarawak laksa noodles before catching a flight.  The coffee was also quite nicely brewed.  Will come back for more!

Best food in Changi. I bought Hainanese chicken rice and three layered coffee. Surprisingly the chicken rice is very fragrant and better than what I found in other places in SG. The pickles are very fresh. The chickens are very tender and fragrant as well. The coffee ises palm sugar, very aromatic
I would like to commend the staff at Gourmet Sarawak for returning my wallet to lost and found. Best kopi in T3 too!
